koala2 documentation

API Documentation

«  Welcome to koala2’s documentation!   ::   Contents

API Documentation¶

For normal use, all you have to do is import the package:

import koala

This will import the following:

  • My amazing Spreadsheet class.

  • The awesome clean_pointer() function.

Cell.py¶

class koala.Cell(address, sheet=None, value=None, formula=None, is_range=False, is_named_range=False, should_eval='normal')¶

CellBase.py¶

class koala.CellBase¶

ExcelCompiler.py¶

class koala.ExcelCompiler(file, ignore_sheets=[], ignore_hidden=False, debug=False)¶

Class responsible for taking cells and named_range and create a graph that can be serialized to disk, and executed independently of excel.

ExcelError.py¶

class koala.ExcelError(value=None, info=None)¶

excellib.py¶

koala.value(text)¶

Using the Spreadsheet Class¶

class koala.Spreadsheet(file=None, ignore_sheets=[], ignore_hidden=False, debug=False)¶
add_cell(cell, value=None)¶

Depricated, see cell_add().

build_spreadsheet(G, cellmap, named_ranges, pointers={}, outputs={}, inputs={}, debug=False)¶

Writes the elements created by gen_graph to the object

Parameters

  • G –

  • cellmap –

  • named_ranges –

  • pointers –

  • outputs –

  • inputs –

  • debug –

cell_add(address=None, cell=None, value=None, formula=None)¶

Adds a cell to the Spreadsheet. Either the cell argument can be specified, or any combination of the other arguments.

Parameters

  • address – the address of the cell

  • cell – a Cell object to add

  • value – (optional) a new value for the cell. In this case, the first argument cell is processed as an address.

  • formula –

cell_evaluate(address)¶

Evaluate the cell.

Parameters

address – the address of the cell

Returns

cell_fix(address)¶

Fix the value of a cell

Parameters

address – the address of the cell

cell_free(address=None)¶

Free the cell (opposite of fix)

Parameters

address – the address of the cell

cell_reset(address)¶

Resets the value of the cell and indicates that an update is required. Also resets all of its dependents.

Parameters

address – the address of the cell to be reset.

Returns

nothing

cell_set_formula(address, formula)¶

Set the formula of a cell.

Parameters

  • address – the address of a cell

  • formula – the new formula

cell_set_value(address, value)¶

Set the value of a cell

Parameters

  • address – the address of a cell

  • value – the new value

gen_graph(outputs=[], inputs=[])¶

Generate the contents of the Spreadsheet from the read cells in the binary files. Specifically this function generates the graph.

Parameters

  • outputs – can be used to specify the outputs. All not affected cells are removed from the graph.

  • inputs – can be used to specify the inputs. All not affected cells are removed from the graph.

reset(depricated=None)¶

Resets all the cells in a spreadsheet and indicates that an update is required.

Returns

nothing
